content.raw:
Ok, I managed to track it down a bit further using `--track-origins=yes`:
~~~
valgrind --verbose --tool=memcheck --track-origins=yes \
  test/integration/INTEGRATION_physics_link --gtest_filter="*AddForce/0"
~~~

It looks like the problem is caused by ODE's heap management ([ode.cpp:1998](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/9abf731199fcee360ae2f7756c567fb37c176306/deps/opende/src/ode.cpp#cl-1998)), and I would guess that `dxEstimateQuickStepMemoryRequirements` is the likely culprit, since that has been touched somewhat recently by @rosebudflyaway and @hsu .
~~~
==6174==  Uninitialised value was created by a heap allocation
==6174==    at 0x4C2AB80: malloc (in /usr/lib/valgrind/vgpreload_memcheck-amd64-linux.so)
==6174==    by 0xEAB359F: InternalReallocateWorldProcessContext(dxWorldProcessContext*, unsigned long, dxWorldProcessMemoryManager const*, float, unsigned int) (util.cpp:772)
==6174==    by 0xEAB4495: dxReallocateWorldProcessContext(dxWorld*, double, unsigned long (*)(dxBody* const*, int, dxJoint* const*, int)) (util.cpp:881)
==6174==    by 0xEA8F0BD: dWorldQuickStep (ode.cpp:1998)
==6174==    by 0x8262B43: gazebo::physics::ODEPhysics::UpdatePhysics() (ODEPhysics.cc:427)
==6174==    by 0x4F336A8: gazebo::physics::World::Update() (World.cc:721)
==6174==    by 0x4F3D52A: gazebo::physics::World::Step() (World.cc:620)
==6174==    by 0x4F3D9EC: gazebo::physics::World::RunLoop() (World.cc:464)
==6174==    by 0x6DA1A49: ??? (in /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libboost_thread.so.1.54.0)
==6174==    by 0x56D2181: start_thread (pthread_create.c:312)
==6174==    by 0x7CE047C: clone (clone.S:111)
~~~
content.html:
Ok, I managed to track it down a bit further using --track-origins=yes:

valgrind --verbose --tool=memcheck --track-origins=yes \
  test/integration/INTEGRATION_physics_link --gtest_filter="*AddForce/0"

It looks like the problem is caused by ODE's heap management (ode.cpp:1998), and I would guess that dxEstimateQuickStepMemoryRequirements is the likely culprit, since that has been touched somewhat recently by @rosebudflyaway and @hsu .

==6174==  Uninitialised value was created by a heap allocation
==6174==    at 0x4C2AB80: malloc (in /usr/lib/valgrind/vgpreload_memcheck-amd64-linux.so)
==6174==    by 0xEAB359F: InternalReallocateWorldProcessContext(dxWorldProcessContext*, unsigned long, dxWorldProcessMemoryManager const*, float, unsigned int) (util.cpp:772)
==6174==    by 0xEAB4495: dxReallocateWorldProcessContext(dxWorld*, double, unsigned long (*)(dxBody* const*, int, dxJoint* const*, int)) (util.cpp:881)
==6174==    by 0xEA8F0BD: dWorldQuickStep (ode.cpp:1998)
==6174==    by 0x8262B43: gazebo::physics::ODEPhysics::UpdatePhysics() (ODEPhysics.cc:427)
==6174==    by 0x4F336A8: gazebo::physics::World::Update() (World.cc:721)
==6174==    by 0x4F3D52A: gazebo::physics::World::Step() (World.cc:620)
==6174==    by 0x4F3D9EC: gazebo::physics::World::RunLoop() (World.cc:464)

content.raw:
Based on the changes in `dxEstimateQuickStepMemoryRequirements` from `gazebo_2.0` [here](dxEstimateQuickStepMemoryRequirements),  
there should be no threatening change for uninitialized variables.   

The places changed is [`EstimatePGS_LCPMemoryRequirements`](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/93ef26c232069fb784e7c464d87d136a64e09f19/deps/opende/src/quickstep.cpp?at=default#cl-625) and [`dxUpdateBodiesMemoryRequirements`](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/93ef26c232069fb784e7c464d87d136a64e09f19/deps/opende/src/quickstep.cpp?at=default#cl-631).  
The two places are about moving `dEFFICIENT_SIZE` function outside the `quickstep.cpp` file
content.html:
Based on the changes in dxEstimateQuickStepMemoryRequirements from gazebo_2.0 here,
there should be no threatening change for uninitialized variables.

The places changed is EstimatePGS_LCPMemoryRequirements and dxUpdateBodiesMemoryRequirements.
The two places are about moving dEFFICIENT_SIZE function outside the quickstep.cpp file

content.raw: Update: the issue is fixed in this [pull request](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1720/fixed-issue-1613/diff)
content.html: Update: the issue is fixed in this pull request
